thread.title: 21 Israeli Foods That Will Make You Say "This Israeli Good"
thread.title_full: 21 Israeli Foods That Will Make You Say "This Israeli Good"

author: Samantha Wieder
title: 21 Israeli Foods That Will Make You Say "This Israeli Good"
text:
View this image ›
Michelle Regna / BuzzFeed ID: 10426707 1. Shakshuka View this image ›
davidlebovitz.com What is it? Eggs in a tomato-based sauce traditionally eaten for breakfast.
Are you looking at that skillet filled with sizzling hot shakshuka. Pretty egg-cellent if you ask me. Recipe here .
ID: 10403905 2. Shawarma View this image ›
paleocupboard.com What is it? Chicken and other meats prepared on a spit.
Listen closely to this shawarma whispering “make me and then eat me!” Recipe here .
ID: 10405232 3. Israeli salad View this image ›
smittenkitchen.com What is it? Salad made of cucumbers, tomatoes, and onions.
Would you look at how aesthetically pleasing this is? Recipe here .
ID: 10412979 4. Rugelach View this image ›
thecrepesofwrath.com What is it? Cookie-like pastry with a variety of different fillings.
Don’t lie, you’re definitely salivating over this flaky-chocolatey rugelach right now…we’re not judging. Recipe here .
ID: 10405785 5. Sabich View this image ›
whatjewwannaeat.com What is it? Fried eggplant and hard boiled eggs in a pita.
There’s a lot of fun going on inside this sandwich. Recipe here .
ID: 10407010 6. Malabi View this image ›
girlcooksworld.com What is it? Rose pudding.
The ultimate sweet-tooth satisfier. Recipe here .
ID: 10414606 7. Falafel View this image ›
toriavey.com What is it? Balls of fried chickpeas.
This perfectly imperfect food can be enjoyed in a pita or on their own because THEY’RE JUST THAT GOOD. Recipe here .
ID: 10412802 8. Hummus View this image ›
thepioneerwoman.com What is it? Mashed chickpeas used as dip or eaten plain.
FYI, chickpeas are practically their own food group in Israel. Recipe here .
ID: 10405306 9. Baba ganoush View this image ›
thehealthymaven.com What is it? Eggplant dip.
You need a private moment with this baba ganoush and that’s okay. Recipe here .
ID: 10405900 10. Schnitzel View this image ›
bonappetit.com What is it? Breaded and fried chicken.
Also known as the eighth wonder of the world. Recipe here .
ID: 10412952 11. Limonana View this image ›
toriavey.com What is it? Frozen mint lemonade.
How refreshing would these be on a hot day? Ask Israel, they would know. Recipe here .
ID: 10414487 12. Bourekas View this image ›
seriouseats.com What is it? Savory pastry made with different fillings such as cheese and spinach.
Soft, warm, and flaky. Is the thought of eating these bourekas making your heart happy? Recipe here .
ID: 10406755 13. Deli roll View this image ›
joyofkosher.com What is it? Puff pastry filled with corned beef, pastrami, and turkey.
You want, no, you NEED this deli roll. Recipe here .
ID: 10413200 14. Tahini View this image ›
inspiredtaste.net What is it? Sauce made from sesame seeds.
You can put this on anything your heart desires like veggies, meat, and falafel. Recipe here .
ID: 10407444 15. Cholent View this image ›
joyofkosher.com What is it? Stew made in a slow-cooker with meat, potatoes and veggies.
Filling and comforting. It’s a win-win. Recipe here .
ID: 10414573 16. Mandel bread View this image ›
toriavey.com What is it? A flaky and doughy Jewish biscotti.
Hey, Italy, you have some competition! Recipe here .
ID: 10414715 17. Kugel View this image ›
whatjewwannaeat.com / Via Twitter: @thekroog What is it? Noodle or potato pudding.
A world without kugel is a world we don’t want to live in and this dairy kugel is the stuff dreams are made of. Recipe here .
ID: 10406057 18. Macaroons View this image ›
thekitchn.com What is it? Coconut cookie that’s crispy on the outside and soft on the inside.
Pro tip: try dipping them in chocolate. Recipe here .
ID: 10414690 19. Jelly roll View this image ›
joyofkosher.com What is it? Sponge cake filled with jelly.
Have your cake and eat it too. Recipe here .
ID: 10414638 20. Challah View this image ›
thekitchn.com What is it? Bread typically eaten on religious occasions.
Perfect as is or as french toast. Recipes here and here .
ID: 10407474 21. Matzo balls View this image ›
tablespoon.com What is it? Soup dumpling.
We can’t forget to pay homage to matzo balls — fluffy little soup pillows that will brighten your whole day. Also perfect to eat on sick days. Recipe here .
ID: 10407395 Check out more articles on BuzzFeed.com!
